definition: Atlas (Titan in Greek mythology)/Atlas mountains of north Africa
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: Currently the Atlas is being human-rated by ULA.
sentences.chinese: 目前阿特拉斯被人评为ULA。

sentences.english: One giant, named Atlas, was forced to hold up the sky.
sentences.chinese: 其中一个叫阿特拉斯的人被迫擎着天。

sentences.english: Atlas got the golden apples for Hercules because he wanted to be the king himself.
sentences.chinese: 阿特拉斯为赫克斯得到金苹果，因为他自己想做国王。

sentences.english: Hercules knew it was Atlas, the Mountain God.
sentences.chinese: 赫拉克勒斯知道这是阿特拉斯，山神。

sentences.english: But Atlas knows that if he shrugs, the world drops to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 但阿特拉斯知道，只要他耸耸肩，世界就会坍塌。

sentences.english: Atlas answered, "My head and arms and shoulders all ache."
sentences.chinese: 阿特拉斯答道，“我的头和手臂和肩膀都痛。

definition: Titan (race of deities in Greek mythology, moon of Saturn etc)
Phoenix, capital of Arizona/also 鳳凰城|凤凰城[Feng4 huang2 cheng2]
the Ural mountains in Russia, dividing Europe from Asia
Loki, god of fire and mischievous destroyer in Norse mythology
